page.title: 12Impact of the M20 motorway
page.content:
The{M20}motorway was designed to be one of the two motorway links between {London and the Channel ports,}the{M2} to{Dover}via{Canterbury}and the{M20}to {Folkestone and Dover}via{Maidstone. So far there are two parts of the M20 built, this one from{Swanley,}where it joins London's Orbital motorway (M25) to just east of{Maidstone.
Since its opening and with a further boost as each part of the M25 opens the{M20}has{taken most}of the{A20 {traffic.} This has had a{dramatic {effect}on businesses that rely on a {passing trade,}like{filling stations and{cafes.} Several in{West Kingsdown have{closed}down in recent years. In their place however, is{growing}a new enterprise, the{small light industrial {estate,}attracted by{easy access}to the{motorway network}via the M20/M25.
